entry.title: extensions: don't rely on content notifications to invalidate CRX cache
entry.content:
On ChromeOS, there exists an external cache of CRX files for extensions.

The class responsible for maintaining that cache (ExternalCacheImpl)

needs to remove entries from it when installs fail, since that usually

indicates the CRX is invalid. That was previously done using a content

notification; this change reimplements that behavior using

InstallTracker instead.



Change-Id: I98dc70620f4e3f9b057537cdcb7f16924b6cbad2

entry.title: [omnibox][cr23] Add selected text colors.
entry.content:
In non-high-contrast mode, selected and unselected suggestions have

similar backgrounds (e.g. light gray and white in light mode), and their

text colors are the same (e.g. black in light mode).



In high-contrast mode, selected and unselected suggestions have

different backgrounds (e.g. black and white), and their text colors need

to swap (e.g. white and black).



Therefore, some text color tokens have a unselected and a selected

variant. E.g. URL blues have tokens `kColorOmniboxResultsUrl` &

`kColorOmniboxResultsUrlSelected`.



Currently, cr23 updates the unselected tokens to cr23 colors, but

doesn't touch the selected tokens. This leads to some suggestions using

the old colors, while some use the new colors - even when not in

high-contrast mode.



This CL updates the selected tokens to be equal to the unselected

tokens. This is correct behavior when not in high-contrast mode, but not

in high-contrast mode; but that's ok since cr23 isn't applied when in

high-contrast mode.



There's also an existing bug where some of the selected colors are

applied to the default suggestion instead of the selected suggestion. We

should probably address this when expanding cr23 to high-contrast mode.



Bug: 1399994

Change-Id: I5dd9d0a17f703f2aa5f3b60cea22c78020f0e8a6

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4702763

Code-Coverage: Findit

entry.content:

wrong spot when touch dragging the cursor in a views::Textfield. Move

the cursor on drag begin (rather than only on drag updates) to fix

entry.title: NoCopyBack: Store margin data in NGPhysicalBoxFragments
entry.content:
Margins are stored as PhysicalFragmentRareData::RareField.



Before this CL, margins for a box were:

A) Set by `NGBlockNode::UpdateMarginPaddingInfoIfNeeded()` for

any blocks, and

B) Overwritten by a container algorithm with `NGBoxFragmentBuilder::

AddResult()`



This CL updates them to store margins in PhysicalFragmentRareData.



* Introduce MutableForContainerLayout class to mutate a physical box

fragment.

It's similar to existing MutableForPainting and MutableForCloning.

We can instantiate MutableForContainerLayout only in the

kInPerformLayout phase.



* NGBlockNode::UpdateMarginPaddingInfoIfNeeded() adds margins to the

fragment.

* NGBoxFragmentBuilder::AddResult() adds margins to a child fragment.



* LayoutBox::MarginBoxOutsets() gets margins from the first physical

fragment.



* Adjust tests for the kInPerformLayout requirement.



This CL should have no behavior changes.



Bug: 1353190

Change-Id: Id026bb7e97e0060f26ca258eaa37a52dbb00a376

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4686850

entry.title: extensions: de-flake ExternalProviderImpl tests
entry.content:
Some of these tests are loading multiple extensions in parallel. Once

they have started the parallel extension loads, they wait for one to

have loaded, then assert that it has the right ID (kStandaloneAppId).

This *usually* works, because kStandaloneAppId is the first extension

that the tests start loading, but it occasionally doesn't, because

extension loading is asynchronous and parallelized.



To fix that, this change has the ExternalProviderImpl tests wait for the

actual extension they are expecting a load of; that way, the tests

assert what they truly want to check (that the target extension loads)

without accidentally asserting that that load completes before the other

extensions that are being loaded.



Fixed: 1457039

Change-Id: I2170c001fd3fa3d50148f4e282491cff75f957a0

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4706223

entry.title: [infra] Reconfigure ownership for //infra/config files.
entry.content:
Before the *.pyl files were generated from starlark, anyone could make

changes to the *.pyl files with the owner requirement satisfied so long

as they had a approval from an owner for any .json files that were

modified as a result. With the move to generating these files from

starlark files, that has regressed because //infra/config/targets

doesn't have an OWNERS file, so it uses the //infra/config OWNERS, which

doesn't enable the various *.json owners to make changes to the

definitions.



In anticipation of the .json files being generated by starlark in the

future, the OWNERS file in //infra/config/generated has been updated so

that files that aren't currently being generated won't be owner by

everyone. This will prevent someone from being able to modify one of the

files in //infra/config/targets that modifies the resulting targets spec

.json files without requiring an actual owner review.



Bug: 1456553

Change-Id: I63a9cb90e37b1086680208125aed1777042e9498

entry.title: [Tab Strip] Fix MSB not aligned when TSR Disabled
entry.content:
- Also fix NTB is slightly off when MSB is visible



The culprit CL is https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4261062, where we unintendedly changed the MSB x-position for TSR disabled.



The correct MSB x-position when TSR disabled:

NTB(24dp) | 24dp | MSB(24dp) | 12dp



The wrong MSB x-position when TSR disabled because of the culprit CL:

NTB(24dp) | 8dp | MSB(24dp) | 24dp



There are two places where we set the paddings incorrectly:

1. in StripLayoutHelperManager#onSizeChanged, we incorrectly applied twice(12dp * 2) the padding between MSB and strip end by calling #getModelSelectorButtonWidthWithPadding. For control, this method should only be called when setting NTB end margin(e.g in #updateModelSwitcherButton()) , because we need to apply bigger padding(24dp) between MSB and NTB in control.



2. With 1 being said, in StripLayoutHelper#setEndMargin, we shouldn't apply NEW_TAB_BUTTON_WITH_MODEL_SELECTOR_BUTTON_PADDING(8dp) for control, this padding should only be used for TSR. And the margin passed from #updateModelSwitcherButton() should already account for padding between MSB and NTB, so we only need to apply NewTabButtonWithTabStripEndPadding.



Before: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/96FmHRZEuxoGe7n

After: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/BpbzuHAf4U8KzzQ

entry.title: [dPWA] Improve `FakeWebAppUiManager::NotifyOnAllAppWindowsClosed`
entry.content:
Before this change, the `FakeWebAppUiManager` would always reset the

number of currently opened windows for an app to 0 when

`NotifyOnAllAppWindowsClosed` was called on it. This made it so that

tests couldn't actually properly test that the code under test is

waiting for all windows to be closed. For example, regardless of whether

a test set the number of open windows to 1 or 0, and regardless of

whether or not the code under test called `NotifyOnAllAppWindowsClosed`,

it wouldn't have made any difference without this CL.

entry.title: Default enable mirroring stats for AccessCodeCast users
entry.content:
For AccessCodeCast users, we want to default-enable mirroring stats,

so we can collect more info when we receive feedback. These stats may

still be turned off, and that setting will persist in a user session.



This change also sets up `GetLogs` in MediaRouterDebuggerImpl, and

ensures the debugger maintains a reference to the appropriate Browser

Context, which will both help us in the case we choose to add mirroring

logs to cast-feedback. (b/271479625)

entry.title: base/threading: Fix setting of RT for kRealTimeAudio for Linux
entry.content:
SetCurrentThreadType() currently sets kRealTimeAudio type tasks to RT

priority if the delegate is not used.



However, SetThreadType() does not. That's inconsistent, fix it.



Further, make SetCurrentThreadType() call SetThreadType() so as to reuse

the code in it and not do the same thing in 2 places.



With this, we also donot need platform_thread_linux.cc to define

SetThreadLatencySensitivity stub for ChromeOS, as platform_thread_cros.c's

SetThreadType() will call it.



Bug: b/262267726

Test: base_unittests --gtest_filter="*ProcessTest.*ThreadBackgrounding*"

entry.title: [omnibox][shortcut] Super shortcut boosting.
entry.content:
The initial approach was to boost the shortcut with the most hits. This

worked really well for 90% of cases, but there was still that 10% of

cases it missed.



When there's a single good shortcut for your input, this worked well.

- E.g. 'dri' -> 'drive.google.com'.



But when there're multiple, it was lacking.

- E.g. 'Joe' ->

Joe/Bob 1:1 doc

Joe's shortcut doc

Joe. gerrit code review

- E.g. 'shortcut' ->

shortcut boosting motivation doc

shortcut boosting beta analysis doc

[omnibox][shortcut] Super shortcut boosting. Gerrit code review

252032: Omnibox: Improve Shortcuts Scoring



When there're multiple shortcuts revisited with the same input

repeatedly, it'd be nice if all (or at least 3) were shown prominently.

This CL adds 2 params to do so:

- Boost all 3 shortcuts with at least N hits.

- Group the boosted shortcuts above searches.



Bug: 812673, 252032

Change-Id: Idef9a68774454bc75c28a6911e4e46975d13b032

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4568772

Reviewed-by: Orin Jaworski

entry.title: Drop manual decoration icon positioning.
entry.content:
This change concludes work on decoration icon rounding issues.



With this change in, the rounding, sizing and placement of the

ImageView will be entirely delegated to Android.



Screens (LTR screens include short, tall and rectangular icons)

- Phone, LTR, Current: http://screen/8gzRdmSBPMLvU89.png

- Phone, LTR, Modern: http://screen/5EVc47Ne5c6w3BH.png

- Phone, RTL, Current: http://screen/TW5vrG2QyFgFUWM.png

- Phone, RTL, Modern: http://screen/BfkYhhPiKxkuDSU.png

- Tablet, LTR, Current: http://screen/5o2qmN8CC6AsvXo.png

- Tablet, LTR, Modern: http://screen/4yNk8q822svwkUp.png

- Tablet, RTL, Current: http://screen/8Pt5WLj6rNotNg4.png

- Tablet, RTL, Modern: http://screen/9dTgVDs7P6BaTbn.png



Revamp specific scenarios (where margins were heavily used) - screens

overlapped with opacity 50%.



- Regular: http://screen/93e8ifQdJCGPJkH.png

- Smaller: http://screen/7yoypJM9Jeagvbq.png

- Smallest: http://screen/6dc2rhXmF4ej97H.png



Note that the positioning of the elements is correct, however in

certain cases rounding issues are corrected. This is particularly

clear with icons such as "the man behind the legend" suggestion:

- Before: http://screen/9jYp2nKWtis4eSH.png

- After: http://screen/CqWdFXXFCqjjq2K.png



Note: this change deletes some tests - but there is redundancy already

in place.



Change-Id: Ia1688195b8897bde96782304f291696a3630fba4

entry.title: Reland "Authentication content control: SAML blocklist"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit a734afc153734ffcea929f262c7fc746b2dbe3ed



This is a second reland attempt. The first attempt is at

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4685988

which was also reverted.



I had to create this reland attempt manually because of merge

conflicts, so it's not linked the usual way.



Original change's description:

> Authentication content control: SAML blocklist

>

> Two new device policies (DeviceAuthenticationURLBlocklist,

> DeviceAuthenticationURLAllowlist) allow admins to control content

> in the login screen and lock screen via a URL blocklist and a

> corresponding URL allowlist. This helps admins close content

> control escapes with undesired navigation during SAML flows on

> managed devices.

>

entry.title: Compare DIPS site, rather than full URL, for Redirect Heuristic.
entry.content:
Comparing the full URL overcounts many 1P redirects between subdomains as 3P redirects. Verified that with this fix, I couldn't reproduce the redirect heuristic except for the one known issue in the wild (https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1616585)

entry.title: VC UI: Fix VC tray button privacy indicators
entry.content:
The previous implementation for the ring around the privacy indicators

of the VC tray buttons does not work anymore since the button background

color is now translucent. Thus, we need to come up with a new way to

draw this ring.



We choose to draw this ring by using bitmap manipulation to draw this

ring on the bitmap of the image. Design rationale is specified in

go/vc-button-indicator.



Also fix the color of the button and the size of the indicator and the

ring.



Fixed: b:288957310

entry.title: [task] Disable AlignWakeUps
entry.content:
It causes 1% regression on speedometer.

https://pinpoint-dot-chromeperf.appspot.com/job/102d41ffe60000



Discussed tradeoffs (notes @ go/zxcep). We will disable for now

and aim to re-enable in an upcoming experiment that:

- Uses OS slack primitives instead of manual alignment

- If necessary, only affects non-interactive (non-focus) pages

- If necessary, only take effect in battery saver mode.



Bug: 1450638

entry.title: [CR2023] Fix SolidRoundRectPainter stroke width with scale.
entry.content:
The stroke size on SolidRoundRectPainter are drawn without scale applied. This makes the border look thinner than other borders. For example, on Mac OS Retina displays where the scale is 2x, the button outline is half the size of dropdown outlines.



Fix is to account for the scale in SolidRoundRectPainter which is used by buttons.

entry.title: Add feature to finalize independent logs in the background
entry.content:
This feature, when enabled, will allow `MetricsProvider`s to

finalize/serialize independent logs in a background thread through a

"serialize_log_callback", before posting back "done_callback" on the

calling thread (which stores the finalized/serialized log in Local

State). Note that calling "serialize_log_callback" is optional. If it

is not called, then "done_callback" will "manually" run it

synchronously. This is because for some `MetricsProvider`s, posting

serialize_log_callback on a background thread and then posting back

done_callback to the main thread could introduce some data loss.





In particular, this could introduce data loss for

StructuredMetricsProvider, which backs some of its data on disk. For

example, the following scenario could cause data loss:

1. StructuredMetricsProvider::ProvideIndependentMetrics() is called.

2. Data is removed from disk, and is filled into the log.

3. Run a task in a background thread to finalize/serialize the log.

4. Run done_callback on the main thread, which will store the

finalized log.

Since the user may close the browser between 3 and 4, 4 may never be

reached, so the data would be lost. Hence, this CL does not serialize

the independent log in a background thread for

StructuredMetricsProvider, even when the feature is enabled. I.e.,

just call done_callback in ProvideIndependentMetrics(), which will

also call serialize_log_callback, so that there is no thread hopping

at all. Though, the proper solution here would be to only remove the

data from disk when we are back from the background thread.





Otherwise, the other independent log providers (AwBackgroundTracingMetricsProvider, FileMetricsProvider, and

BackgroundTracingMetricsProvider) will finalize/serialize their

independent logs in the background when the feature is enabled. For

BackgroundTracingMetricsProvider, the feature will also make it so

that it does its work in a background thread.

You may be wondering, "Couldn't this data loss scenario happen for

these providers as well?"

=> For FileMetricsProvider, no. This is because PMA files are already

being "processed" and "filled into a log" in a background thread,

and the PMA files are only marked as read and deleted when we are

back on the main thread.

=> For AwBackgroundTracingMetricsProvider and

BackgroundTracingMetricsProvider, not really. Yes, it is true that

the log they produce in their ProvideIndependentMetrics() would be

lost if it posts the serialize_log_callback in a background

thread, and the user closes the browser before done_callback is

posted/run back on the main thread. However, this is already

somewhat the case. The MetricsService polls the `MetricsProvider`s

every ~15 minutes (MetricsService::PrepareProviderMetricsTask()).

If the provider indicates that it can create an independent log

(by returning true in through HasIndependentMetrics()), then

we call its ProvideIndependentMetrics(). However, if the browser

is closed before this 15 minute poll occurs, then the provider,

even though it could have produced an independent log, won't be

called, and the data is "lost". So then this CL's feature extends

this "data loss window" by a very small margin. (The way to

protect against this is by having the data on disk, like

FileMetricsProvider and StructuredMetricsProvider do).





When this feature is disabled, this CL should be a no-op.





Also changes some TODO comments to point to a more appropriate bug.

entry.title: Cancel Eye Dropper selection when window is deactivated.
entry.content:
Currently, activating a different window than the one from which an EyeDropper was invoked produces a confusing experience in which the EyeDropper grid will be rendered behind the active window and no cursor will be displayed on the screen. Additionally, activating a different application than Chrome while the EyeDropper is active produces a similar experience, but in this case the cursor is visible. In both cases, mouse interactions such as clicks are delivered to the active window/application while the EyeDropper remains in the background. Since the EyeDropper needs its window to remain active (at the top of other windows) in order to appropriately pick a color from other windows/applications, this change cancels the EyeDropper selection when its window is deactivated.

entry.title: Add option to send automatic beacons only once.
entry.content:
Automatic beacons currently have a design flaw that can cause extra

unwanted beacons to be sent out. For example, a top-level navigation

beacon is set in a click handler for an ad when the user clicks on the

ad. If the ad's visual display is programmed to change to have a button

that says "why this ad?" after the ad is clicked (the button will take

the user to an explainer page when clicked), then the automatic beacon

data will still be in place. If a user clicks back to the tab the ad is

on and clicks on "why this ad?" to perform a different top-level

navigation, the beacon will send out again as if the user clicked on the

ad normally. This creates an erroneous impression and results in

incorrect data being sent to reporting servers.



To fix the issue, this CL introduces a new parameter to the `FenceEvent`

dictionary: `once`. It defaults to false (to preserve the current

default behavior of automatic beacons). If set to true, when an

automatic beacon is sent out, the automatic beacon data will be cleared.



This CL also moves `AutomaticBeaconInfo` implementation functions from

"fenced_frame_reporter.cc" to "fenced_frame_config.cc" to reflect the

fact that its definition lives in "fenced_frame_config.h".



Change-Id: I1240557844a3c47c680a0f3d8a227e31794ab49f

entry.title: [remoting host][win] Synthesize touch move events to keep touch points alive
entry.content:
Windows requires touch events to be constantly injected within a

specific interval (seems to be 1s based on observations) to keep touch

points alive. Web touch APIs do not yield touch move events if the user

hasn't moved their finger around (e.g. in press-and-hold scenario),

which is problematic.



We currently have a workaround on the client to synthesize touch move

events periodically (b/265364404). However, this logic is better off

implemented on the host side since the logic is cleaner, and it helps

avoid things like impacts by jitters in network latency.



This CL implements the keep-alive logic on the host, similar to what we

did on the client in cl/514559312. The synthesizing logic does not

interfere with TouchMoveSynthesizer, since if the host is sending touch

moves frequently, then no keep-alive events will be synthesized.



Tested with TouchMoveSynthesizer enabled and disabled on the client and

verified that long-press works for either case. In a future CL, I will

disable TouchMoveSynthesizer on the client if the host version indicates

that it supports synthesizing keep-alive events.

entry.title: [iOS][Toolbar] Fix toolbar coordinator initialization
entry.content:
Toolbar coordinator initialization is failing due to the trait

collection being updated when primary toolbar is starting. This causes

the toolbar to layout but secondary toolbar hasn't started yet.



This CL:

- Disable traitCollectionDidChange when coordinator is not started.

- Move mediator trait collection update to `updateToolbarsLayout`.



updateToolbarsLayout is called by traitCollectionDidChange and in start

after everything is setup. Moving the mediator trait collection update

updateToolbarsLayout ensures that the trait collection is up to date for

the first layout.

entry.title: CSC: More general handling for z index.
entry.content:
Implement more general handling for z index. Removed the temporary implementation that Pierre had put in earlier and hard-coded a setting for z index filtering in the config proto, including the config proto that comes in from cacao, in the case when it is missing that setting, because otherwise the behavior would not be enabled immediately.

entry.title: Video: Disable ref lists in non-VAAPI platform H.264 Decoding
entry.content:
The H.264 decoder was setup with reference list operations for P and B

frames respectively. While this logic is used for VAAPI operations,

they are completely unused in other implementations (e.g. V4L2,

Mac, Windows). This resulted in a non-trivial amount of dead code

in the Decode call.



Updates the H.264 decoder to put ref list logic behind a member

boolean. The decoders will pull this value from their respective accelerators. By default the h264 accelerator will have this flag be false. Updates the VAAPI h264 accelerator to use ref lists.



This change results in only the VAAPI logic updating and utilizing ref

lists, while all other platforms can safely ignore them.



BUG=b:263412777

TEST= Ran h264_baseline, main, and high on Asurada and Brya



Change-Id: Iaff2c4eab0042fd488d9de0716bc41ae4de14dba

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4702042

entry.title: Replace cloud_devices::printer::Media ctors with MediaBuilder
entry.content:
The cloud_devices::printer::Media struct currently has 5 constructors

for various combinations of input parameters. The number of constructors

will go up in the future as the struct take on more fields to represent

additional types of media.



Create a MediaBuilder class to build Media structs in a step-by-step

manner. Then future Media changes will scale linearly and not

combinatorically. Though the callers to MediaBuilder has to write more

verbose code, it is also much easier to understand what the builder is

doing.



Change-Id: I5f59eeeaa5c0b9fd9f7ea25afa4176c9661650cf

explicitly enabled in the test fixture.

- fushcia-arm64-rel and linux-chromeos-chrome: enable kEvictSubtree to

evict the BFCached main frame Surface.



The changes are between PatchSet1 and onward.



Original change's description:

> Temporarily invalidate old LocalSurfaceIds of DelegatedFrameHost for

> all navigations.

>

> Prior to this CL, for a navigation (includes activation):

> - WCImpl::DidNavigateMainFramePreCommit()

> - RFHManager::CommitPending()

> - RWHV::Show()

> - DelegatedFrameHost::EmbedSurface() --> Updates IDs.

> - WCImpl::DidNavigateMainFramePostCommit()

> - RWHVBase::OnDidNavigateMainFrameToNewPage() --> Clears IDs.

>

> This flow is problematic in several cases (known ones):

> 1. RWHVMac::OnDidNavigateMainFrameToNewPage does not reset

> DelegatedFrameHost. It wasn't an issue until the fix for a visual

> glitch of ViewTransition+BackForwardCache

> (https://crbug.com/1415340 and [0]).

> 2. (On Aura) Because OnDidNavigateMainFrameToNewPage is called after

> EmbedSurface, for a page restored from BFCache, we could end up

> with a DelegatedFrameHost without a valid LocalSurfaceId (if there

> is no follow up EmbedSurface call after

> OnDidNavigateMainFrameToNewPage). See https://crbug.com/1431273

> - Android gets away with this because Android has extra visual

> synchronization calls that triggers EmbedSurface.

> - Mac/IOS gets away with this because of 1.

>

> This CL renames OnDidNavigateMainFrameToNewPage to

> DidNavigateMainFramePreCommit, and calls it earlier in PreCommit:

> - WCImpl::DidNavigateMainFramePreCommit()

> - RWHVBase::DidNavigateMainFramePreCommit() --> Clears IDs

> - RFHManager::CommitPending()

> - RWHV::Show()

> - DelegatedFrameHost::EmbedSurface() --> Updates IDs

> - WCImpl::DidNavigateMainFramePostCommit() --> Other post-commit tasks

>

> This CL also introduces RWHVBase::DidEnterBackForwardCache, to be used

> when a page enters BFCache to update its LocalSurfaceId:

> - WCImpl::DidNavigateMainFramePreCommit()

> - RWHVBase::DidNavigateMainFramePreCommit() --> Clears IDs

> - RFHManager::CommitPending()

> - RFHManager::UnloadOldFrame()

> - RFHImpl::DidEnterBackForwardCache()

> - RWHVBase::DidEnterBackForwardCache() --> Restores IDs

>

> [0] http://docs/document/d/1g-VBsVVd8tKMzJIJGFooPOCDpxLwlbJTIsNnMOjSef0?resourcekey=0-ChPbTFNCu3C482SVdT4X9Q

>

> the killswitch.

>

> Low-Coverage-Reason: untested WebContentsImpl changes are guarded by

> Bug: 1453638, 1415340, 1431273

> Change-Id: I3f1a4fc1a8981fe8fe9cc61207e1b2d0325bd16c

entry.title: multi_display: Remove WindowState::RestoreState
entry.content:
This cl mostly removes the WindowState::RestoreState that introduced

by crrev.com/c/4103928. As after crrev.com/c/4417085, it is only

useful when `restore_bounds_override_` is set. And that will only be

set when window horizontal/vertical maximization happens.



We are going to handle the horizontal/vertical maximization inside

DefaultState::EnterToNextState instead. The restore bounds set by

horizontal/vertical maximization will be saved/restored before/after

window state changes there.

`kRestoreBoundsKey` will be cleared on `window_state_restore_history_` instead of window state to keep them consistent.



See b/290657501 for more details.



Bug: b/290657501

Tests: WindowStateTest* and other existing tests

entry.title: Enable the consistently passing tests in RenderWidgetHostViewAuraOverscrollTest
entry.content:
This change is part of the effort to re-enable consistently passing

tests across the entire chromium.

If the tests are reasonable, please LGTM and I will proceed to submit

the change.

If the tests are unreasonable, please let me know and I will remove

them.





------ How the change is created ------



I do not inspect each individual test case, the idea is to run the

disabled tests on reviver builders

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/g/reviver/builders and use the

aggregated results to decide if a previously disabled test is now

consistently passing.



Usually I create changes by directly enabling the tests. If the tests

are failing on platforms not covered by the reviver builders or

explicitly mentioned in the associated bugs, I may conditionally

enable them on certain platforms.

But other than that, I won't include extra changes except for the

ones suggested by `git cl format`.





------ How to inspect the reviver builder results ------



You may choose a platform you are interested,

e.g. chromium/reviver/lacros-coordinator.

[link: https://ci.chromium.org/p/chromium/builders/reviver/lacros-coordinator]

In the baseline builder / buildbucket.schedule step, e.g.

chromium/ci/linux-lacros-builder-rel - buildbucket.schedule,

there will be a luci run link.

[ex: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/reviver/runner/b8776966777608450081/overview]





------ Aggregated results of the tests involved ------



The following list shows how many times the changed tests were

*consistently* passing on the relevant builders.



content/test:content_unittests/RenderWidgetHostViewAuraOverscrollTest.GestureScrollDebounceTimerOverscroll

127 fuchsia-fyi-arm64-dbg

150 fuchsia-fyi-x64-dbg

192 fuchsia-x64-rel

110 linux-lacros-tester-rel

entry.title: [Tracing w/SDK] Fix Java event name filtering with multiple sessions
entry.content:
Tracing config has a field for filtering package names from Java

tracing event names. Since configs are per-session, this requires

special treatment in the case of multiple parallel tracing sessions.



This CL implements the strict option: if at least one active session

has this field set, all sessions will get filtered event names.

entry.title: chromeos: Ensure display is powered on via test_runner.py
entry.content:
When a test suite like 'ozone_gl_unittests' runs on device it issues the

command 'stop ui' to stop the running chrome instance and release the

GPU lock on the display. Ensure the display stays powered on by sending

a user activity ping to powerd.



We anticipate needing this for 'chromeos_integration_tests' which will

run on hardware.



Bug: 1464750

Test: added to test_runner_test.py

Test: out_dedede/Release/bin/run_chromeos_integration_tests --board=dedede --device=localhost:2222 --enable-pixel-output-in-tests --user-data-dir=/tmp/udd --disable-mojo-broker --stop-ui --gtest_filter=AppList*



Change-Id: Ib06150525936b7fe7fef061019e2a1a92d8c6cd5

entry.title: CrOS Settings: Refactor Router override from tests
entry.content:
Simplifies how browser tests update the Router singleton instance and

set of available routes. Instead of overriding a specific route object

or needing to create the set of routes manually, only a single function

`createRouterForTesting()` needs to be called to create the set of

routes and a new Router instance.



Bug: b/291151247
